intro: Dysphania rhadinostachya subsp. rhadinostachya, commonly known as redroot spinach, is a herbaceous annual plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and lanceolate, often hairy leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers in dense clusters, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. Its roots are reddish in color, giving the species its common name, and the leaves are edible, though they have a mild, spinach-like flavor. Dysphania rhadinostachya subsp. rhadinostachya is often cultivated as a leafy vegetable in some parts of the world.
